text: He didn’t enter the draft he was just randomly picked. He was walking down campus when someone told him he was picked in the draft Earl Francis Lloyd (April 3, 1928 – February 26, 2015) was an American professional basketball player. He was the first black person to play in the National Basketball Association, in the 1950–51 NBA season. Three other African Americans played in the same season: Chuck Cooper, Nathaniel Clifton, and Hank DeZonie. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Detroit Pistons players Category:Sportspeople from Virginia
